title: Tooltip
reference-overview: The Tooltip feature provides the user additional information/detail on Form Input fields that is not initially displayed. This additional information displayed with the Tooltip shouldn't be crucial, required functionality, content needed to interact with the interface. It is simply a bit of additional information that would be considered helpful to the user, not essential.
reference-usage: Designers should use the Tooltip when the amount of information displayed is short in length (10-15 words maximum) and not critical to the user. For longer content (more than 15 words or images) use the Content Menu.
reference-details:
Text

  • The designer should use concise language in the Tooltip, no more than 15 words.
  • The Tooltip must be plain text.

Height/Width

  • The Tooltip has a maximum width of 200 pixels but can be smaller based on content.
  • The height of the Tooltip should be dynamic and based on the content included.

Color

  • The Tooltip container should have a light blue (#e7f0f9) color background.
  • The Tooltip container should have a light gray (#cccccc) border color.
  • The Tooltip text will be dark gray (#333333).

Placement

  • The Tooltip's placement relative to the link should be dynamic, based on how much space is available.
  • By default, the Tooltip should display above the link. However, if there is limited space, it should be able to dynamically shift to the bottom.

Accessibility

  • The Tooltip container will open when the user mouses over the parent element and will disappear when the user moves the mouse away from the parent element.
reference-mobile:
• The tooltip will open on tap. If the user taps the already open tooltip, it will close.
  • The font size of the content wihtin the tool tip will increase for mobile.
reference-technical:
Cross browser compatibility

IE9 doesn't crop background gradients on containers with rounded corners, so we square the corners of every container so it looks just like IE8.
reference-code-html-content-block-pre:
Below are different class-based options you can use to modify the position of the tooltip in relationship to the text or object that you are using with a toolitp.

For individual text-based elements

Use one of the follow classes to change the position of an individual text-based element on the page.

  1. js-mul-tooltip-hover-top
  2. js-mul-tooltip-hover-right
  3. js-mul-tooltip-hover-bottom
  4. js-mul-tooltip-hover-left

For non-text based objects like icons, images, or form elements

Use one of the follow classes to change the position of the tooltip with a group of icons or other non-text based objects like images or form elements.

  1. js-mul-tooltip-hover-top-object
  2. js-mul-tooltip-hover-right-object
  3. js-mul-tooltip-hover-bottom-object
  4. js-mul-tooltip-hover-left-object
